stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session rebuilding the second course’s interior (Divine Dino Domain), replacing a disliked auto-scroll leaf-boat segment with a new platforming playground featuring vines, staircases and a Yoshi-god statue. He also updates viewers on overall progress (≈80 % complete), reports Course 12 as mostly finished, outlines themes for Courses 13-15, and mentions a persistent water-physics crash.

development_findings.summary: The original leaf-boat auto-scroll in Course 2 was scrapped; the area is now a free-movement platforming playground with climbable vines, spiral stairs, hanging rides and a Yoshi statue.
development_findings.quote: I realized the section sucked, so now we have a little bit of a platforming playground here.

development_findings.summary: Project completion is a little over 80 %; only Courses 13-15 remain.
development_findings.quote: How much percent finished? Just above 80. We're getting there.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 will be a mysterious, suspenseful ice castle; Course 14 a space arcade; Course 15 is still undecided.
development_findings.quote: Course 13 is going to be... an ice castle, very suspenseful, and Course 14 is going to be a space arcade, but I'm not 100 % on Course 15.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 is essentially done except for a few Zeina animations and sign text.
development_findings.quote: I finished Course 12 off-stream… there's a few more animations from Zeina I have to put in the game, but then Course 12 is all good to be shipped.

development_findings.summary: Water uses an outdated step function; entering water can crash the game until it is rewritten.
development_findings.quote: Water hasn't been updated to the new step function yet… being in water can just crash the game.

development_findings.summary: Long loading times and graphical oddities in the revised Course 2 suggest a level-specific bug that Kaze will diagnose later.
development_findings.quote: Interesting, interesting. Maybe this is related to the really long loading time we had just now.

development_findings.summary: All areas currently load into RAM together because the decomp build cannot use the old ROM Manager per-area loader, costing memory.
development_findings.quote: That loads the areas one by one… but that is made for binary, so we can't use it with decomp.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 (a Blender add-on) is the primary level-export tool, producing F3D data directly from Blender.
development_findings.quote: We're using Fast 64 for that… it is a Blender extension that exports F3D.

development_findings.summary: Parallel N64 emulator is avoided for debugging due to frequent updates, controller issues and bugs not present on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: It's just not a good emulator for me.

development_findings.summary: Kaze backs up all project files, including models, to Git; total size remains under 100 MB, fitting easily under github limits.
development_findings.quote: All my files are below 100 megabytes, so it's fine.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s hair was accidentally shaved into a bald stripe by Zeina; he hides it with a beanie and monetises reveals through subscriptions.
context_findings.quote: Basically, Zeina slipped with the hair clippers and just put a bald spot there.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes barbers, calling them a waste of time and money, reflecting a DIY mindset.
context_findings.quote: First of all, barbers, you waste so much time. Second, they cost money.

context_findings.summary: Kaze tracks YouTube analytics obsessively, rewriting video titles for higher click-through and views.
context_findings.quote: YouTube is all about the angle.

context_findings.summary: He avoids Patreon bonuses to reduce legal risk with Nintendo, and half-jokes that Nintendo might "murder" him if he is sued.
context_findings.quote: I also don't give out any Patreon bonuses, because that might get me in legal trouble with Nintendo.

context_findings.summary: Reported monthly YouTube revenue is roughly $450, highlighting modest financial returns.
context_findings.quote: My first YouTube channel… income this month was around $450.

context_findings.summary: Prefers self-teaching; advises learning Blender by reading official documentation and testing every hotkey.
context_findings.quote: I opened the documentation on page one and then I just tried every hotkey… that is the peak way of learning it.

biobak.summary: Biobak’s feedback on Blender snapping is cited; Kaze finds the current snapping behaviour "uncontrollable."
biobak.quote: Dude, I hate Biobak snapping. It feels so uncontrollable.

zeina.summary: Zeina provided remaining animations for Course 12 that still need to be imported.
zeina.quote: There's a few more animations from Zeina I have to put in the game.

zeina.summary: She asked Kaze not to show an already-built area of Course 14 to avoid spoilers.
zeina.quote: I have a whole area done on Course 14 that I can't show you guys because Zeina doesn't want me to show it.

zeina.summary: Personal dynamic: Zeina accidentally shaved a bald line in Kaze’s hair, leading to light-hearted blame and teasing on stream.
zeina.quote: You hear that, Zeina? That's how much you fucked me up.

key_stories.title: Haircut Catastrophe
key_stories.summary: Zeina tried to tidy Kaze’s hair but removed the clipper guard, carving a bald stripe across his head. Kaze now streams in a beanie and gamifies partial reveals for subs.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain appearance after accidental bald line.
key_stories.process: Wore a beanie, offered incremental reveals for gifted subs, joked with chat.
key_stories.outcome: Comic relief for the community; plans to either shave fully or let hair grow before shaving again.
key_stories.key_quote: There's just the fucking bald line here… I promise you, it is the stupidest haircut you've ever seen.

key_stories.title: Reinventing Course 2
key_stories.summary: Kaze decided the old auto-scroll leaf-boat section felt dull, so he re-envisioned the area as a more engaging, free-movement platforming hub.
key_stories.challenge: Original layout was boring and restrictive for early-game players.
key_stories.process: Removed boats, sketched new geometry in Fast64, added vines, spiral stairs, water exits and a Yoshi-god statue with a prayer platform.
key_stories.outcome: Block-out completed on stream; art pass, UV mapping and Yoshi statue polish to be finished off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: The section sucked, so now we have a little bit of a platforming playground here.

key_stories.title: Water Physics Crash
key_stories.summary: The water step function still uses legacy code no longer fully supported, so entering water can crash the game, creating anxiety when testing water areas.
key_stories.challenge: Critical gameplay element can crash the ROM on contact.
key_stories.process: Kaze warns viewers, avoids water during testing, notes need to rewrite function.
key_stories.outcome: Issue acknowledged but unresolved; slated for future fix.
key_stories.key_quote: Being in water can just crash the game.

open_questions.context: Kaze repeatedly mentions needing a boss idea for the mysterious ice castle and invites chat brainstorming.
questions: What kind of boss mechanics fit the tone of a suspenseful ice castle?
Who on the team will design and implement the boss?
Are there technical constraints (e.g., memory, animation) driving boss scope?

open_questions.context: Course 15 remains undecided while other late-game levels have clear themes.
questions: What candidate ideas are being considered?
How does Course 15 need to differ from earlier lava/rainbow analogues?
Is there a narrative or progression reason delaying the decision?

open_questions.context: Legacy water code crashes; Kaze acknowledges but hasn’t fixed it.
questions: What is the plan and timeline for rewriting water physics?
Who is responsible, and what new approach will be used?
Could this delay release or require design compromises?

open_questions.topic: Per-area memory loading for decomp build
open_questions.context: Current build loads all areas at once, unlike previous ROM Manager workflow, increasing memory usage.
questions: Will the team attempt a new per-area loader for decomp?
What are the RAM limits they are hitting?
Who might tackle the linker-script work needed?

open_questions.topic: Role and status of composer Badub
open_questions.context: Badub’s contributions are not mentioned in this stream.
questions: What stage is the soundtrack in?
How does Badub collaborate with level designers?
Are there technical constraints for music on real N64 hardware?
